# Science Mom (science.mom)

> Hands-on science and math curriculum for homeschool families, created by Science Mom (Jenny Ballif) and Math Dad (Serge Ballif).

## Who We Are

Science Mom & Math Dad are a family team creating online science and math courses. Science Mom has a master's degree in plant science and has worked as a molecular biologist. Math Dad has a PhD in mathematics from Penn State University. They live in Alaska with their three kids and two dogs.

## What We Offer

### Paid Courses (on Teachable)
Full science and math courses designed for homeschool students, typically upper elementary through middle school:
- **Biology courses** (Biology 1 & 2) - Evolution, genetics, classification, ecology
- **Chemistry course** - Atoms, molecules, reactions, periodic table
- **Earth Science course** - Geology, weather, astronomy
- **Math courses** - Various levels from 4th/5th grade through pre-algebra

Courses include:
- Video lessons with clear explanations
- Doodle notes for following along
- Hands-on activities using simple household materials
- Live sessions or self-paced replays

URL: https://sciencemom.teachable.com

### Free Resources
- **Videos**: 100+ educational YouTube videos on science and math topics
- **Experiments**: Step-by-step science experiments kids can do at home
- **Printables**: Foldable books, worksheets, and activity guides

### Community (via Patreon)
- Weekly Chess Club sessions
- Painting with a Scientist art sessions
- Exclusive worksheets and bonus content

URL: https://www.patreon.com/sciencemom

## Teaching Philosophy

- **Secular curriculum** - Evidence-based science education that accurately covers topics like evolution
- **Clarity first** - Concepts explained in plain language, built step-by-step
- **Hands-on learning** - Experiments and projects that make abstract concepts tangible
- **Family-friendly pricing** - One price covers all students in a household
- **Flexible** - Join live, watch replays, or go fully self-paced

## Target Audience

- Homeschool families seeking quality science/math curriculum
- Parents who want engaging, non-gimmicky educational content
- Students in upper elementary through middle school (though younger and older students also benefit)
- Families looking for secular science education

## Content Topics

### Science Topics Covered
- Biology: cells, genetics, evolution, classification, ecosystems, human body
- Chemistry: atoms, elements, compounds, reactions, states of matter
- Earth Science: rocks, minerals, weather, climate, geology, astronomy
- Physics: forces, motion, energy, simple machines, sound, light
- Nature: animals, plants, ecology, field guides

### Math Topics Covered
- Arithmetic and number sense
- Fractions, decimals, percentages
- Pre-algebra concepts
- Problem-solving strategies
